commits.message:
Hotfix work for EUCA-12205 - Availability Zones have a hard coded maximum of 2048 instances.

Description: Change the max number of instances to be a configurable value (CC_MAX_CORES)

Changes:
 - Added configuration options for a restart only variable CC_MAX_CORES.
 - Defaults to 2048 if not defined in the configuration file.
 - Split the instance cache into two structures to easily create shared memory segments.
 - Changed the ccInstanceCache to be an array element instead of members that were arrays
 - config->ccMaxCores is used to allocate the shared memory segment.
 - setup of the caches (instanceCache and sensorCache) is moved out from init_thread() to its own
   function so that it can be allocated after init_config(). This ensures that the configuration
   is valid (config->ccMaxCores) and avoids segmentation faults.
 - Also includes a fix for EUCA-12269

Testing:

EUCA-12269 - sensory memory allocation is incorrect in /util/sensor.c

Description: EUCA_ZALLOC arguments were reversed.

Changes:
 - Used malloc to allocate the correct amount of memory needed for the datastructure
 - Used memset to zero out the memory needed.

Testing:
 - QA concise regression test
